English: You have come.
Chinese: 我才在想你差不多快來了呢。
Korean: 슬슬 와 줄 때가 됐다고 생각했어
German: Du bist gekommen.

English: Who is this?
Chinese: 這個人……是誰？
Korean: …이 사람, 누구?
German: Wer ist das?

English:
A devoted seeker of truth. A Cyber Sleuth made
thrall to the Digimon that swim and soar in this
realm.
Chinese:
這孩子是在電腦空間的波流中漂流的數碼奴隸，
也是那個女偵探的忠誠僕人——
Korean:
이 아이는, 전뇌공간의 파도를 헤엄치는
디지털의 노예이자, 여탐정의 충실한 하인―
German:
Jemand, der gewissenhaft die Wahrheit sucht.
Ein Cyber-Detektiv im Dienst der Digimon, die
in dieser Welt herumstreifen.

English:
And furthermore, your savior. The one who can
break free your destiny.
Chinese:
而且，他會拯救妳……
對，他可說是妳“命中注定的人”呢。
Korean:
그리고, 널 도와 줄…
그러네, 말하자면 "운명의 사람"이야
German:
Und außerdem die einzige Person, die dein
Schicksal ändern und dich retten kann.

English: Thrall... Cyber Sleuth... What do you mean?
Chinese: 既是奴隸又是僕人的他……是我命中注定的人？
Korean: 노예이자 하인이… 내 운명의 사람?
German: Dienst ... Cyber-Detektiv ... Was soll das heißen?

English:
Allow me to make introductions, then. [p],
this young lady is Sayo.
Chinese: [p]，我來向你介紹吧……這女孩叫做小夜。
Korean: [p], 소개할게… 이 아이는 사요
German:
Wenn ich euch also vorstellen darf.
[p], diese junge Dame ist Sayo.

English:
She is a Digimon Tamer from another world. One
so very unlike your own.
Chinese:
和你我所在的這個世界不同──
她是從平行世界來的數碼寶貝馴獸師唷。
Korean:
너와 내가 있는 이 세계와는 다른 세계…
패럴렐 월드에서 온, 디지몬 테이머야
German:
Sie ist eine Digimon-Zähmerin aus einer anderen 
Welt. Einer, die der deinen kaum ähnelt.

English:
You see, Miss Sayo's beloved partner, Dianamon,
was taken from her.
Chinese:
其實呀，小夜的伙伴「狄安娜獸」
突然消失了。
Korean:
실은 말이야, 사요의 파트너인「디아나몬」이
갑자기 모습을 감춰 버렸어
German:
Weißt du, Fräulein Sayos geliebte Gefährtin
Dianamon wurde ihr genommen.

English:
We came to get her back. We went to the DigiLab
and just appeared here.
Chinese:
所以，我向數碼實驗室的米蕾小姐請教後，
她就把我從我原來的世界帶到這個世界來。
Korean:
그래서, 디지랩의 미레이 씨에게 상담해 봤더니
원래 있던 세계에서 이쪽 세계로 끌려왔다는 거야
German:
Wir sind hier, um sie zurückzubekommen. Wir sind
ins DigiLab gegangen und hier aufgetaucht.

English:
Is that all you want of me, Mirei? To find
Dianamon again?
Chinese:
但是，米蕾小姐，
我只是想要取回狄安娜獸耶？
Korean:
하지만 미레이 씨, 난 디아나몬을
되찾고 싶을 뿐인데?
German:
Ist das alles, was du von mir willst, Mirei?
Dianamon wiederzufinden?

English:
How can this girl be a part of my destiny?
She's... nothing.
Chinese:
為什麼這麼瘦弱又脆弱、看起來意志薄弱的孩子
會是我命中注定的人呢？
Korean:
어째서 이런 빈약하고 취약하고 의지박약할 것 같은 애가
내 운명의 사람인 거야?
German:
Wie kann dieses Kind Teil meines Schicksals sein?
Es ist ... ein Nichts.

English:
There's gotta be something more! Tell me what's
really going on here!
Chinese:
我無法接受這種事……
請妳好好說明到底是什麼回事！
Korean:
그런 거, 납득할 수 없어…
뭐가 어떻게 된 건지, 제대로 설명해 줘!
German:
Da muss doch mehr dahinterstecken!
Sag mir, was hier wirklich los ist!

English:
There is much that stands between you and your
Dianamon. To recover her, you must face and
defeat the Seven Deadly Digimon.
Chinese:
要取回狄安娜獸，
必須打倒所有「七大魔王」。
Korean:
…디아나몬을 되찾으려면,「7대 마왕」의 디지몬을
전부 쓰러뜨릴 필요가 있어
German:
Viele Hindernisse trennen dich von deinem
Dianamon. Du musst den Sieben Dämonenkönigen
gegenübertreten und sie besiegen.

English:
What?! All of the Seven Deadly Digimon!
Are you crazy?!
Chinese: 咦？七大魔王的話，我已經全部打倒了唷？
Korean: 에!? 7대 마왕이라면, 내가 전부 쓰러뜨렸는데!?
German:
Wie?! Alle Sieben Dämonenkönige?!
Bist du wahnsinnig?!

English: Do you know of the Seven in your world?
Chinese: 那是「妳所在的世界的七大魔王」吧？
Korean: 그건,「네가 있던 세계의 7대 마왕」이잖아?
German: Kennst du die Sieben in deiner Welt?

English:
They who stand above all magical Digimon. Crowned
as the Highest of the High, evil is inborn to
creatures such as they.
Chinese: 位居惡魔系數碼寶貝頂點的七隻魔王型數碼寶貝「七大魔王」──
Korean: 악마계 디지몬의 정점에 선 7체의 마왕형 디지몬「7대 마왕」
German:
Sie stehen über allen magischen Digimon. Wesen
wie ihnen, die zu den Allerhöchsten gekrönt
werden, wohnt das Böse inne.

English:
Their power is beyond imagining, so much that they
exist simultaneously in all parallel worlds.
Chinese:
它們擁有強大的力量，
因此存在於所有平行世界……
Korean:
그들은, 그 강대한 힘 때문에
모든 평행 세계에 존재하고 있어…
German:
Ihre Macht ist so unvorstellbar groß, dass sie
gleichzeitig in allen Parallelwelten existieren.

English:
It is a type of defense for them. By being in so
many forms across the spectrum of time and space,
they disperse their power.
Chinese:
那就像是一種封印——
因為存在於各個世界，它們的力量是分散的。
Korean:
그건, 일종의 봉인 같은 것으로―
각 세계에 존재함으로써, 그들의 힘은 분산되어 있는 거야
German:
Es ist für sie eine Art Verteidigung. Sie
verteilen ihre Macht, indem sie in so vielen
Gestalten im Spektrum von Raum und Zeit bestehen.

English:
Their existence is... natural. A primal factor of
the universe.
Chinese:
沒有人安排，這只是依循宇宙的法則，
而自然發生的系統。
Korean:
누군가가 그렇게 만든 게 아닌, 우주의 섭리로서
자연 발생한 시스템이야
German:
Ihre Existenz ist ... von der Natur vorgegeben.
Ein Grundsatz des Universums.

English:
By slaying the Seven Deadly Digimon of your world,
Miss Sayo, you have granted them strength in every
other. Including my own.
Chinese:
小夜，你們打倒了妳的世界的七大魔王，
使得這個世界的七大魔王的力量增加。
Korean:
사요, 너희들이, 네 세계의 7대 마왕을 쓰러뜨렸기 때문에
이 세계의 7대 마왕의 힘이 더욱 강해졌어
German:
Indem du die Sieben Dämonenkönige in deiner Welt
getötet hast, Fräulein Sayo, hast du sie in allen
anderen gestärkt. So auch in meiner.

English: No...
German: Nein ...

English:
The punishment for this sin was the loss of your
Dianamon.
Chinese: 為了「懲罰」這件事——　妳的狄安娜獸被消除了。
Korean: 그「벌」로서― 네 디아나몬이 사라진 거야
German:
Die Strafe für diese Sünde war der Verlust
deines Dianamon.

English:
Wh-What?! But we didn't know that would happen!
We didn't mean to!
Chinese: 怎……怎麼這樣！？我並沒有打算要……！！
Korean: 그… 그럴 수가…!? 나, 그럴 생각은…!!
German:
W-Was?! Aber das wussten wir nicht!
Das wollten wir nicht!

English:
I understand, but knowing or not makes little
difference. It was a consequence.
Chinese: 嗯，也是呢……不過，事情已經發生。
Korean: 응, 그렇겠지… 하지만, 이건 이미 일어나 버린 일이야
German:
Das verstehe ich, doch es macht keinen
Unterschied. Dies ist die Konsequenz.

English:
Your Dianamon can return home to you, Miss Sayo,
but to make that happen, you must defeat the
Seven that reside in this world.
Chinese:
只要不打倒這個世界的七大魔王，
妳的狄安娜獸就不會回來……
Korean:
이 세계의 7대 마왕을 쓰러뜨리지 않는 한
네 디아나몬은 돌아오지 않아…
German:
Dein Dianamon kann zu dir zurückkehren, Fräulein
Sayo, doch dazu musst du die Sieben in dieser Welt
besiegen.

English:
The terrible irony is that, without Dianamon,
I fear you are not strong enough to face them.
Chinese: 沒有狄安娜獸的妳，是無法和七大魔王較量的。
Korean: 디아나몬이 없는 넌, 7대 마왕에게 맞설 수 없어
German:
Das Tragische daran ist, dass ich fürchte, dass
du ohne Dianamon nicht stark genug sein wirst.

English:
Hence, I have brought [p] to you. They
are entwined with destiny. They shall defeat the
Seven to save Dianamon from an unjust fate.
Chinese:
所以[p]，由你去討伐七大魔王，
為了救出遭受不合理懲罰的狄安娜獸。
Korean:
그러니까 [p], 네가 7대 마왕을 토벌하는 거야
불합리한 벌을 받은 디아나몬을 구하기 위해서
German:
Daher habe ich [p] zu dir gebracht.
[p] ist mit dem Schicksal verwoben,
wird die Sieben besiegen und Dianamon retten.

English:
No! That's not fair! I'm still a Tamer and I
won't let someone else fight my battles for me!
Chinese:
…但、但是，身為一個馴獸師，我也是有自尊的好嗎……
居然要全部交給這孩子……
Korean:
…하, 하지만, 나에게도 테이머로서의 프라이드가 있어…
이 애에게 전부, 맡긴다니…
German:
Nein! Das ist ungerecht! Ich bin immer noch ein
Zähmer und lasse nicht andere für mich kämpfen!

English:
True... In your world you are powerful. Champion
of the Coliseum, and a renowned Tamer.
Chinese:
是啊……因為妳在那邊的世界
是個在競技場得過冠軍的頂級馴獸師嘛。
Korean:
그러네… 너, 네가 있던 세계에서는
콜로세움에서 우승한, 가장 우수한 테이머니까
German:
Fürwahr ... In deiner Welt bist du mächtig.
Champion des Kolosseums und berühmt unter den
Zähmern.

English:
But in this world, Miss Sayo, you have no such
strength. Tell me, which matters more; your pride
or your partner?
Chinese:
可是，現在的妳沒有力量——
伙伴和自尊，哪個比較重要呢？
Korean:
하지만, 지금의 넌 무력한 존재―
파트너와 프라이드, 어느 쪽이 소중해?
German:
Doch in dieser Welt, Fräulein Sayo, ist das nicht
der Fall. Was ist dir wichtiger: dein Stolz
oder dein Partner?

English: ...Dianamon...
German: Dianamon ...

English:
It's not the same! It's not enough! I can't just
accept this weak, little slip of a girl as my
destiny!
Chinese:
我完全、絕對、怎樣都不會相信
這麼瘦弱又脆弱、看起來意志薄弱的孩子，竟然會是我命中注定的人……
Korean:
이런 빈약하고 취약하고 의지박약할 것 같은 애가
내 운명의 사람이라니, 도저히 절대 단연코 믿기지 않지만…
German:
Das ist nicht das Gleiche! Das reicht nicht!
Ich kann dieses schwächliche Kind nicht als mein
Schicksal akzeptieren!

English:
But... I have no choice do I. *sigh*
I... I will trust you.
Chinese: 不過現在……我相信米蕾小姐。
Korean: 지금은… 미레이 씨를 믿을게
German:
Aber ich habe wohl keine Wahl. *Seufz*
Ich ... werde auf dich vertrauen.

English: But that doesn’t mean I respect you!
Chinese:
別誤會唷。
我可沒有認同你喔。
Korean:
…착각하지 말아 줘
나, 널 인정한 건 아니니까
German: Aber das heißt nicht, dass ich dich respektiere!

English: It is decided...
Chinese: 就這麼說定囉。
Korean: …결정됐네
German: Dann ist es also entschieden ...

English:
Now, [p], the path is at your feet.
We are to put our faith in you and see the Seven
defeated.
Chinese: 那麼，[p]……討伐七大魔王的事，就拜託你囉。
Korean: 그럼, [p]… 7대 마왕의 토벌, 잘 부탁해
German:
Der Weg liegt nun vor dir, [p].
Wir werden auf dich vertrauen und die Sieben
besiegt sehen.

English:
When you are ready, I can divine the locations of
the Seven Deadly Digimon.
Chinese:
我會幫你占卜七大魔王的所在地……
你準備好的話，就來跟我說一聲。
Korean:
7대 마왕의 장소는, 내가 점쳐 줄게…
준비가 끝나면 말을 걸어 줘
German:
Wenn du bereit bist, kann ich ersinnen, wo die
Sieben Dämonenkönige sich befinden.

English: All things are within the wheel of fate...
Chinese: 一切都會按照命運的引導。
Korean: …모든 건 운명이 이끄는 대로
German: Alles ruht auf dem Rad des Schicksals ...

English:
I suppose I should do this properly. My name is
Sayo, Tamer of the "Night Claw" from Dark Moon
City...
Chinese:
我是黑暗月亮城市的馴獸師集團
「Night Crow」的小夜……
Korean:
난 다크문 CITY의 테이머 팀
「나이트 크로우」의 사요…
German:
Dann mache ich mal den Anfang. Ich heiße Sayo und
bin Digimon-Zähmer der „Night Claw“ in Dark Moon
City ...

English: Please... help me bring Dianamon home.
Chinese: 請多指教。
Korean: 잘 부탁해
German:
Bitte ... hilf mir, Dianamon wieder nach Hause zu
holen.
